TaxonIdentification.species_authority: (A. Gray) G. L. Nesom & G. I. Baird
TaxonIdentification.variety_authority: (Greene) G. L. Nesom & G. I. Baird

treatment.description: Plants 10–20 cm (branches slender). Leaves moderately crowded, green; blades 1(–3)-nerved, linear, 30–50 × 0.5–2 mm, faces glabrous, minutely gland-dotted; distalmost about equaling arrays. Heads 6–20+ in lax (much-branched), racemiform to thyrsiform arrays. Involucres 12.5–15 mm. Phyllaries 9–13, chartaceous, apices erect (tan or greenish), attenuate. Florets 5–7; corollas yellow, 9–11 mm, tubes glabrous or proximally puberulent, throats gradually dilated, lobes 1.5–1.9 mm. 2n = 18.
treatment.discussion: Variety vulcanica grows in the southern Sierra Nevada.
